title: Western Leftists are the most pro-communist scumbags

replies.msg:
【Repost】
Western Leftists have been fanatically backing the most murderous tyrannies around the world. Communism was created & put into practice by Leftists. There's virtually NO such thing as " A Leftist not supporting Communism ". No matter how some of them coat themselves, the essence is still crystal clear to any sensible beings on the Right.

Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez has never criticised China. Bernie Sanders refuses to condemn Maduro as a "dictator", let alone he praised the Soviet Union in the 1980s.

Sean Penn, Naomi Campbell, Danny Glover, Code Pink & numerous Western Leftists are super fans of the mafia-fascist Bolivarian "revolution" built on oil-wealth-looting & mass-murdering opposition with death squads ("colectivos"). Their online profiles are full of "Chavez eyes" resembling that of the Big Brother.

Noam Chomsky, Edward S. Herman, Malcolm Caldwell, Gunnar Bergström & numerous "anti-war" students deny the Khmer Rouge Genocide due to their Marxist mindset.

Noam Chomsky & Norman Finkelstein act as race traitors to their Jewish state by flirting with Neo-Nazis, backing Palestinian terrorists firing rockets over the border to kill Jews, demonising Israel with NO regard to the fact that Israel has been attacked FIRST by Arab Coalition for SIX times since 1948.

Max Blumenthal, Benjamin Norton, George Galloway & numerous "New Left" dumbasses support Bashar & every pro-Putin tyrant in the world. They also slander the HK protests as a "CIA-sponsored coup"...

If you think these examples are not enough, watch RT or check them out on anti-US posts on Facebook & Twitter!

That old fat Sanders praised the Soviet Union & endorsed the Sandinista (Nicaraguan Commies)'s massacre of dissident in the 1980s. Yet, Western Leftists love this tyrant-lover so fucking much & think that he's sort of "champion of freedom". What a joke

https://twitter.com/carlbildt/status/1100039769810235393



http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/05/bernie-sanders-pro-sandinista-past-problem.html

"...New York Times reported on Bernie Sanders’ 1980s-vintage foreign-policy stands, which at times crossed over from mere opposition to American policy to outright support for communist governments. Sanders initially refused to speak with the reporters, but after the article appeared, he called one of them and gave an extremely crusty interview. Now he has a video framing the issue, which he says is about “my opposition to war” and refusal to apologize for his opinions."

https://www.thedailybeast.com/when-bernie-sanders-thought-castro-and-the-sandinistas-could-teach-america-a-lesson

"In 1985 Sanders traveled to New York City to meet with Daniel Ortega a few weeks after Nicaragua imposed a “state of emergency”, mass arrests of the socialist regime's critics, and the shuttering of opposition newspapers and magazines. Sanders refused to condemn the decision...Sanders later said that the Sandinistas’ brutal crackdown “makes sense to me.” TV talk-show host Phil Donahue told Ortega that his actions looked "fascist".

replies.msg:
Both Western politics and the situation in HK is a lot more complicated than just Left and Right.

For one, the political spectrum isn’t just bidirectional but you have to consider also authoritarianism vs libertarianism as well of which there are people of both Left and Right on both sides. Anarchists are left wing but are also heavily libertarian as they believe the power of the state simply should not exist. There are right wing libertarians who simply call themselves Libertarians or Classical Liberals. Communists are left wing but are heavily authoritarian as they believe the state should be in control of everything. Fascists are right wing but also authoritarian.

Hong Kong doesn’t really have a Left vs Right conflict although there are plenty of people here with views that could be attributed to either side both on the pro-democracy and pro-Beijing side. China itself isn’t Communist at all or even remotely Socialist as there are Western European countries who are more Socialist than China yet don’t describe themselves as Socialist countries. China is a fascist country with a state-controlled capitalist system, Hong Kong’s fight against China is one against authoritarianism, not Communism or Leftism.

Max Blumenthal, Benjamin Norton, George Galloway & numerous "New Left" dumbasses support Bashar & every pro-Putin tyrant in the world. They also slander the HK protests as a "CIA-sponsored coup"...

If you think these examples are not enough, watch RT or check them out on anti-US posts on Facebook & Twitter!

Both Western politics and the situation in HK is a lot more complicated than just Left and Right.

For one, the political spectrum isn’t just bidirectional but you have to consider also authoritarianism vs libertarianism as well of which there are people of both Left and Right on both sides. Anarchists are left wing but are also heavily libertarian as they believe the power of the state simply should not exist. There are right wing libertarians who simply call themselves Libertarians or Classical Liberals. Communists are left wing but are heavily authoritarian as they believe the state should be in control of everything. Fascists are right wing but also authoritarian.

Hong Kong doesn’t really have a Left vs Right conflict although there are plenty of people here with views that could be attributed to either side both on the pro-democracy and pro-Beijing side. China itself isn’t Communist at all or even remotely Socialist as there are Western European countries who are more Socialist than China yet don’t describe themselves as Socialist countries. China is a fascist country with a state-controlled capitalist system, Hong Kong’s fight against China is one against authoritarianism, not Communism or Leftism.

replies.msg: To add to this I will agree that there is an issue in socially progressive circles of Western society of being able to recognise fascism from more than just one skin tone.
